sections.name: Berberoka
Kabourophobia
sections.text: Berberokas share an unusually intense fear of crabs, so many folktales suggest fishers bring a crab with them should they suspect a berberoka nearby. If no crab is available, clicking one's tongue or snapping one's fingers might suffice.

link.name: Pathfinder #166: Despair on Danger Island pg. 82
link.alt: Pathfinder #166: Despair on Danger Island pg. 82

sections.text:
Berberokas are giant humanoids who live among forests and swamps, where they use their ability to swallow massive amounts of water to drain small ponds and lakes. Creatures who visit their favorite watering hole and find only an empty mud basin become prey for the berberoka, who hides in the brush and overwhelm their prey with a massive torrent of regurgitated water.  
  
 A berberoka's mottled backside—which resembles a bundle of local plants, small trees, and large rocks—grants them natural camouflage that allows them to hide in plain sight. Berberokas tend to disguise themselves as rock formations in the center of a dried-up waterbed while they lie in wait for passersby. In the tropical regions where berberokas are most common, locals know to give empty ponds a wide berth, regardless of the enticing fish flopping about. Hungry travelers, on the other hand, might see such bounty as a blessing from the gods, only to be swept up in the berberoka's deadly deluge.

link.name: Pathfinder #166: Despair on Danger Island pg. 82
link.alt: Pathfinder #166: Despair on Danger Island pg. 82

link.name: Pathfinder #166: Despair on Danger Island pg. 82
link.alt: Pathfinder #166: Despair on Danger Island pg. 82

traits.name: Uncommon
traits.text: Something of uncommon rarity requires special training or comes from a particular culture or part of the world. Some character choices give access to uncommon options, and the GM can choose to allow access for anyone. Less is known about uncommon creatures than common creatures. They typically can't be summoned. The DC of Recall Knowledge checks related to these creature is increased by 2.

traits.name: Evil
traits.text: Evil effects often manipulate energy from evil-aligned Outer Planes and are antithetical to good divine servants or divine servants of good deities. A creature with this trait is evil in alignment.

traits.name: Humanoid
traits.text: Humanoid creatures reason and act much like humans. They typically stand upright and have two arms and two legs.

link.name: Pathfinder #166: Despair on Danger Island pg. 82
link.alt: Pathfinder #166: Despair on Danger Island pg. 82

modifiers.name: +31 to Impersonate a small mound or island in its native environ

interaction_abilities.name: Deep Breath
interaction_abilities.text: A berberoka can hold their breath for 2 hours.

automatic_abilities.name: Fear of Crabs
automatic_abilities.failure: The berberoka gains the fleeing condition for 1 round and is frightened 4.

traits.name: Emotion
traits.text: This effect alters a creature's emotions. Effects with this trait always have the mental trait as well. Creatures with special training or that have mechanical or artificial intelligence are immune to emotion effects.

traits.name: Fear
traits.text: Fear effects evoke the emotion of fear. Effects with this trait always have the mental and emotion traits as well.

traits.name: Mental
traits.text: A mental effect can alter the target's mind. It has no effect on an object or a mindless creature.

automatic_abilities.text: If a berberoka sees a crab or crab-like creature, the berberoka must attempt a DC 33 Will save. They then becomes immune to the sight of that creature for 10 minutes.

traits.name: Reach
traits.text: Natural attacks with this trait can be used to attack creatures up to the listed distance away instead of only adjacent creatures. Weapons with this trait are long and can be used to attack creatures up to 10 feet away instead of only adjacent creatures. For creatures that already have reach with the limb or limbs that wield the weapon, the weapon increases their reach by 5 feet.

ability.name: Consume Lake

traits.name: Manipulate
traits.text: You must physically manipulate an item or make gestures to use an action with this trait. Creatures without a suitable appendage can’t perform actions with this trait. Manipulate actions often trigger reactions.

ability.text: The berberoka drinks a prolific amount from an adjacent water source. If the water source is equal to or greater in volume than themself, the berberoka consumes up to 1,500 gallons of water per minute and becomes waterlogged. They can release water at the same rate. While waterlogged, the berberoka can use Spray Water, their size grows to Gargantuan, and their Speed is reduced to 15 feet.

ability.name: Spray Water
ability.effect: The berberoka sprays a blast of water in a 60-foot line. All creatures in the line take 6d8 bludgeoning damage (DC 35 basic Reflex save). On a failed save, a creature is knocked prone and pushed back 5 feet (10 feet on a critically failed save).
